subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 4 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)
exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 4 moles H2 produce 4 moles H2O.

exp: For weak acid HA, [H+] ≈ sqrt(Ka×c) = sqrt(0.00027×0.036) ≈ 0.003118 M.

subject: Chemistry
q: Which factor primarily determines the chemical reactivity of an element in a period?
options: Effective nuclear charge and valence electron configuration
exp: Reactivity across a period depends on effective nuclear charge and valence electrons, influencing ionization energy and electron affinity.

subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 1 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)
exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 1 moles H2 produce 1 moles H2O.
